page.title: 14HISTORY FROM 1900
page.content: CASTLE VALE WAS ONCE AN IMPORTANT WAR TIME AIRFIELD CALLED THE CASTLE BROMWICH AIRFIELD.IN 1914 IT WAS USED TO TRAIN AIRMEN.THE NUMBER 10 SQUADRON OF THE ROYAL FLYING CORPS WAS BASED HERE. AT THE END OF THE 1914-18 WAR IT BECAME A PRIVATE AIRFIELD AND BIRMINGHAM AIR PAGEANTS WERE HELD THERE EACH YEAR. AS WORLD WAR 2 BEGAN THE 600 SQUADRON WAS BASED AT THE AIRFIELD.AT VICKERS FACTORY IN NEARBY CASTLE BROMWICH 11,690 SPITFIRES AND 305 LANCASTER BOMBERS WERE PRODUCED FROM 1940-46.AT ITS PEAK 300 SPITFIRES WERE BUILT AND TESTED HERE PER MONTH.THE CHIEF TEST PILOT WAS ALEX HENSHAW.OVER 37,000 TEST FLIGHTS WERE CARRIED OUT ON NEW PLANES WHICH WERE THEN CARRIED TO R.A.F BATTLE OF BRITAIN STATIONS.AT THE END OF THE WAR THE R.A.F RESERVES USED THE AIRFIELD.
